clinical_study.brief_title: Single-center Prospective Study to Validate the Performance of the Aktiia Optical Blood Pressure Monitoring (OBPM) Device at the Wrist Against Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM)
clinical_study.official_title: Single-center Prospective Study to Validate the Performance of the Aktiia Optical Blood Pressure Monitoring (OBPM) Device at the Wrist Against Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM)

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the performances of optical blood pressure monitoring device, Aktiia.product in the context of cardiac rehabilitation program.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean absolute error for blood pressure
primary_outcome.description: The mean absolute error between the Reference (standard ambulatory blood pressure monitor) and Aktiia.product for systolic (SYS) and diastolic (DIA) blood pressure in mmHg
The mean error between the Reference and Aktiia.product for SYS and DIA in mmHg

primary_outcome.measure: Standard deviation of the error for blood pressure
primary_outcome.description: The standard deviation of the error between Reference and Aktiia.product for SYS and DIA in mmHg

primary_outcome.measure: Mean absolute error for heart rate
primary_outcome.description: The mean absolute error between the Reference (standard ambulatory blood pressure monitor) and Aktiia.product for heart rate in bpm
The mean error between the Reference and Aktiia.product for heart rate in bpm

primary_outcome.measure: Standard deviation of the error for heart rate
primary_outcome.description: The standard deviation of the error between Reference and Aktiia.product for heart rate in bpm

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the impact of ABPM induced stress on BP readings using inferential statistics.
secondary_outcome.description: Aktiia values acquired during the first day (with ABPM) will be compared to values acquired during other days of the week and a t-test will be performed. The analysis will be repeated for night values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of patient's satisfaction for the two devices through a survey with multiple questions
secondary_outcome.description: 10-points likert scale survey, an agree-disagree scale with minimum 0 and maximum 10. Minimum value means strong disagreement, maximum value means strong agreement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the calibration stability of Aktiia OBPM algorithms
secondary_outcome.description: Use different calibration points going from 1 to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of systolic and diastolic blood pressure control during a 12 weeks cardiac rehabilitation program
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of blood pressure determinations taken at the beginning and at the end of the program in ambulatory settings

intervention.description: The participants wear Aktiia.bracelet for the duration of the cardiac rehabilitation program. The device is initialized once per week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult subjects (aged between 21 and 65)
- Subjects fluent in written and spoken French
- Subjects enrolled in a 12-weeks cardiac rehabilitation program
- Subjects agreeing to participate
- Subjects that have signed the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with tachycardia (heart rate at rest > 120bpm)
- Subjects with atrial fibrillation
- Subjects with severe heart failure (LVEF<35%)
- Subjects with severe renal dysfunctions (eGFR < 30mL/min/1.73 m2)
- Subjects with pheochromocytoma
- Subjects with Raynaud's disease
- Subjects with trembling and shivering
- Subjects with interarm systolic difference > 15 mmHg
- Subjects with interarm diastolic difference > 10 mmHg
- Subjects with arm paralysis
- Women in known pregnancy
- Subjects with an arteriovenous fistula
- Subjects with arm amputations
- Subjects with the upper arm circumference > 64 cm
- Subjects with the wrist circumference > 22 cm
- Subjects with the exfoliative skin diseases
- Subjects with lymphoedema
